section.para: This validator allows you to validate if a given string conforms a defined regular expression.
The following options are supported for Zend_Validate_Regex:

listitem.para: pattern: Sets the regular expression pattern for this validator.

section.para: Validation with regular expressions allows to have complicated validations being done without writing a own validator. The usage of regular expression is quite common and simple. Let's look at some examples:
section.programlisting:
$validator = new Zend_Validate_Regex(array('pattern' => '/^Test/');
$validator->isValid("Test"); // returns true $validator->isValid("Testing"); // returns true $validator->isValid("Pest"); // returns false
section.para: As you can see, the pattern has to be given using the same syntax as for preg_match(). For details about regular expressions take a look into PHP's manual about PCRE pattern syntax.
It is also possible to set a different pattern afterwards by using setPattern() and to get the actual set pattern with getPattern().
